    • Field Detail

      • game

        private GameEngine game
        This object is medium between UI and Grid

      • debugMode

        private boolean debugMode
        the boolean variable to on and off for the debug mode if debug mode is on the output will show all the enemies, powerups,rooms and where the briefcase is located. if the debug mode is off the output will only display only rooms and the player.

      • keyboard

        private java.util.Scanner keyboard
        need scanner object for accepting input from the user's insturctions

      • option

        private java.lang.String option
        assign the values the user enter in this object.

      • quitGame

        private boolean quitGame
        this boolean will say if the game finish or not

      • UI

        public UI(GameEngine game)
        this is the default constructor with parameter game type GameEngine

    • Method Detail

      • startGame

        public void startGame()
        This method is the main loop for the game This method will ask the user to choose 3 options which are New Game , Load Game and Leave game. According to the user option different methods are called.

      • gameLoop

        public void gameLoop()
        this method is called when the user choose the option new game. this method handles almost all the interaction between user and the program. In this method the player has option to 1. Move(take 1 turn). 2. Shoot any direction(take 1 turn). 3. Use Goggle any direction before move or shoot. 4. Saving the game. 5. Quit the game.

      • welcomeMessage

        private void welcomeMessage()
        This is method is called once the program is started. In message, explains how the game works and the tools the player can use. The last thing is the character representation of each object on the display.

      • playerShoot

        public void playerShoot(boolean shoot)
        This method will print according to
        Parameters:
        shoot. - if shoot is true, the player killed a ninja. if false, the player hit the wall.

      • checkBullet

        private boolean checkBullet()
        This method check if the player has bullet.
        Returns:
        true if the player has a bullet and false if there is no bullet

      • playerMove

        public java.lang.String playerMove(int scenario)
        This method prints the every possible scenario after the player moves.
        Parameters:
        scenario - will decide what string should be returned.
        Returns:
        the scenario String according to the parameter.
